result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin James Brown

records.addlTxt:
1:53 PM Defendant Kevin James Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Kevin James Brown.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
22TR424 tracking with 22CF46:
Atty Severson states that the matter is not yet resolved and states that there is still information that needs to be sorted out; requests another status be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:35 PM Defendant Kevin James Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Kevin James Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Severson states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the amended information and states that the arraignment was done on that already.

Atty Severson has a couple issues that he is looking into; requests another status.  Atty Severson is also looking into Treatment Court.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin James Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Kevin James Brown. 
Atty Severson requests further status as there are a few issues he is looking into.  Atty Burdon makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  State is to file an amended Information.  Set for further status
Status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Atty Burdon filed the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Severson received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Atty Severson enters a Not Guilty plea.
Atty Burdon states that they are waiting on blood test results and there may be another charge.  Atty Severson has no objection with proceeding and that an amended information may be filed.
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Court will enter a Not Guilty plea for the 2nd charge if in fact that is filed.

1:03 PM Defendant Kevin James Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Kevin James Brown.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Severson states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin James Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Kevin James Brown. 
Atty Severson states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Severson waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 000973,
Payable Number: 74402,
Receipt Number: 22R 001783,
Amount: $20.00

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol  *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  *Defendant is to submit to a breath test at the request of Law Enforcement with reasonable suspicion of alcohol

3:26 PM Defendant Kevin James Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  
Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant was hoping for a signature bond since he hasn't had anything on his record for 17 years.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*Defendant is to submit to a breath test at the request of Law Enforcement with reasonable suspicion of alcohol
Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
